bropals.lib.simplegame

Class GameStateRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • bropals.lib.simplegame.GameStateRunner

  • public class GameStateRunner
extends java.lang.Object
    Continuously runs the update and render loop of a GameState object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameStateRunner(GameWindow window)
      Creates a GameStateRunner with a GameWindow.
      GameStateRunner(GameWindow window, GameState initialState)
      Creates a GameStateRunner with an initial GameState.

    • Method Detail

      • setFps

        public void setFps(int fps)
        Set how many frames per second this GameStateRunner runs at.
        Parameters:
        fps - How many frames per second this GameStateRunner will run at.

      • setState

        public void setState(GameState state)
        Sets the given GameState tot be the current state. The state that was there before is removed after onExit() is called in it. onEnter is called in the new GameState.
        Parameters:
        state - The new GameState

      • renderState

        protected void renderState(GameState state)
        So we can extend and change how we render in other GameStates

      • loop

        public void loop()
        Endlessly loops the current GameState until something goes wrong.
